metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3192 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Pivotal Spring Framework before 3.2.14 and 4.x before 4.1.7 do not properly process inline DTD declarations when DTD is not entirely disabled, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption and out-of-memory errors) via a crafted XML file. Toshiaki Maki discovered that Spring Framework incorrectly handled certain XML files. A remote attacker could exploit this with a crafted XML file to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3192` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libspring-aop-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm2
libspring-beans-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm2
libspring-context-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm2
libspring-context-support-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm2
libspring-core-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm2
libspring-expression-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm2
libspring-instrument-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm2
libspring-jdbc-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm2
libspring-jms-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm2
libspring-orm-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm2
libspring-oxm-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm2
libspring-test-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm2
libspring-transaction-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm2
libspring-web-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm2
libspring-web-portlet-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm2
libspring-web-servlet-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm2
libspring-web-struts-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libspring-java package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.0.6.RELEASE-13ubuntu0.1~esm2').
